title: Letter: Repainting the Jag is a way to beat the lockdown blues
text:
I remain unpersuaded by Josh Spero's promotion of the merits of the colour black (“So over the rainbow: why I wear black”, Life & Arts, January 8).

In the depths of lockdown, my Jaguar sports car, painted in black, began to symbolise to me the gloom of that period. In defiance, I had it repainted in a glorious shade of American red — “Kandy Apple Red”, an iridescent riot of colour.

The shade I chose matched the colour of a pair of crimson cord trousers that I had bought earlier, in a first attempt to lighten my spirits.

I urge Spero to return colour to his wardrobe. The knock-on effects are glorious.

Jerry Blackett
Solihull, West Midlands, UK
